Key Match Events: The Cubs trailed 10-3 after six innings but scored 11 runs in the final three frames for a comeback victory.
Christian Bethancourt delivered a bases-loaded single in the ninth inning to give the Cubs an 11-10 lead with an exit velocity of 105.9 mph and 106.1 mph on his two-run homer and double respectively.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Counsell praised Christian Bethancourt's performance, highlighting his clutch hits and RBIs.
Christian Bethancourt expressed pride in his ability to contribute despite initial struggles earlier in the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs scored 41 runs in the three-game series against strong pitchers, showcasing their offensive strength.
The bullpen was tested but managed to secure the victory despite several absences.
Others: The Cubs' win provided momentum as they aim to catch up in the playoff race, with a focus on continuing their strong offensive performance.
